messages.title: Your Vote Counts
messages.content: Vote Labour to save frontline services from Cameron's Cuts.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Give top priority to securing recovery in our local economy.
Work to bring in more jobs, and employment guarantees for school leavers.
Work closely with our schools, hospitals and police to provide top quality local services.
Make sure that the broadest shoulders bear most of the burden.
Work to renew the workings of government and Parliament to strengthen democracy and give you more say.

issues.economy: Labour supported the economy through the world recession. Recovery is now under way.
issues.education: With Labour we have the best ever results in our local schools.
issues.governance: Better Politics - work to renew the workings of government and Parliament to strengthen democracy and give you more say.
issues.health: Crime in our district is down by one-third, and average waiting times at Warwick hospital are down to just five weeks.
issues.socialWelfare: Cameron’s top tax priority is to give a £200,000 tax cut to the 3,000 richest families in the country - partly paid for by cuts in Child Tax Credit.

leaflet.personalStatement: James does the job the way it should be done. He's accountable; he works very hard and he always puts our interests first.

contactInformation.address: Unit 2 Creative Arches, Court Street, Leamington Spa, CV31 2DH

endorsements.endorsement: James does the job the way it should be done. He's accountable; he works very hard and he always puts our interests first.

quotes.text: With Labour we have the best ever results in our local schools, crime in our district is down by one-third, and average waiting times at Warwick hospital are down to just five weeks.

images.caption: James Plaskitt with people discussing policies.
James Plaskitt with mechanics looking at a car engine.
